title: Ziza
html: ZIZA(Ziʹza).1. A son of King Rehoboam by Absalom’s granddaughter Maacah. When the royal succession was directed to Ziza’s brother Abijah, Ziza received gifts of cities, food, and wives from Rehoboam.—2Ch 11:20, 22, 23.2. One of the Simeonite chieftains who expanded their grazing land by annexing Hamite territory and destroying its inhabitants during the reign of Hezekiah; son of Shiphi.—1Ch 4:24, 37-41.
